data.title: CONTENTdm
data.meta_description: In 1913 Porter and his family moved down the road from his birthplace in Peru to Westleigh Farms, built for them by his domineering grandfather, James Omar Cole. Cole was a coal and timber speculator known as "the richest man in Indiana." He had invested in property at the confluence of the Wabash and Mississinewa rivers, some of which was purchased from Miami Indians. After high school, Porter only returned to the farm for occasional visits.
